instruction: Analyze this inbound email for phishing indicators. Provide classification and the key red flags.

input.subject: Your PayPal Account Has Been Limited
input.body: Dear user, unusual activity has been detected. Click the link below to restore full access to your account: hxxp://secure-paypal-check.com/login

output.description: Email impersonates PayPal, urging the recipient to follow a phishing link for account verification.
indicators: Sender domain does not match official PayPal domain
Urgent tone claiming account limitation
Link to a fraudulent site mimicking PayPal login page
Generic greeting ('Dear user') instead of name

instruction: Review this email claiming to offer an unclaimed tax refund. Classify and describe red flags.

input.subject: IMPORTANT: Unclaimed Tax Refund
input.body: Hello, you have an unclaimed tax refund of $1,280.30. Complete verification at hxxp://irs-taxes-update.net/verify

output.description: Phishing email masquerading as an IRS notification about a tax refund.
indicators: Domain not associated with IRS (.gov)
Claim of a specific refund amount to lure clicks
Call to action requiring immediate verification
Likely attempts to gather personal/financial info

instruction: Determine if this email from a 'webmail admin' requesting password updates is legitimate or phishing.

input.subject: Your Password Will Expire Soon
input.body: Attention user, your mailbox password expires in 24 hours. Renew now: hxxp://companymail-support.co/reset

output.description: Email impersonates a webmail administrator to obtain the user’s login credentials.
indicators: Sender domain not matching official company domain
Urgent expiration claim
Link to a non-SSL or suspicious URL
Generic salutation with no personalization

instruction: Identify the nature of this email about an undelivered package. Provide indicators of phishing.

input.subject: Delivery Failed: Package #331205
input.body: We could not deliver your package. Please click here to arrange redelivery: hxxp://postdelivery-failed.com/schedule

output.description: Phishing email pretending to be a postal service with a link to reschedule a fake delivery.
indicators: Random domain (postdelivery-failed.com)
Generic 'we could not deliver' claim
No legitimate tracking details
Likely requests personal or payment info

instruction: Assess this email offering a loan pre-approval. Is it phishing or legitimate marketing?

input.subject: You Are Pre-Approved for $50,000
input.body: Congratulations! Get your loan by entering your details here: hxxp://loanpreapproved-instant.info/form

output.description: Phishing disguised as a pre-approved loan offer, seeking personal/financial details.
indicators: High loan amount with no checks
Suspicious domain with no brand recognition
Immediate request for sensitive data
Likely identity theft attempt

instruction: Classify this email about a 'System Update' requiring user credentials.

input.subject: Important System Update: Action Required
input.body: Dear Employee, log in with your username and password at the link below to complete mandatory security updates.

output.description: Phishing email targeting employees, asking for credentials under the guise of a security update.
indicators: Unrecognized domain (comp-secureupdates.io)
Lack of official corporate signature or branding
Mandatory login request without context
Likely credential-stealing link

instruction: Determine if this email claiming a 'locked bank account' is real or phishing. Highlight reasons.

input.subject: Action Required: Bank Account Locked
input.body: We noticed suspicious transactions. Verify your identity now: hxxp://banknotice-verify.com/login

output.description: Email impersonates a bank, claiming suspicious activity to panic users into clicking a phishing link.
indicators: Non-official domain (banknotice-verify.com)
Threat of account lockout
Redirect to a login page collecting credentials
No mention of specific transaction details

instruction: Review this email from an unknown domain offering a software update. Is it a safe download?

input.subject: Critical Software Patch Available
input.body: Install the attached file immediately to fix critical vulnerabilities. Failure to install may cause data loss.

output.description: Email urging recipients to open an attachment for a fake software update, likely containing malware.
indicators: Sender domain unrelated to known software vendor
Attachment to execute a 'patch'
High-pressure language about critical vulnerability
Potential malicious file disguised as an update

instruction: Analyze this 'Yahoo! Prize' email for phishing tactics. Provide the classification.

input.subject: Final Notice: You’ve Won $100,000!
input.body: Congratulations! You are a winner in our Yahoo promotion. Provide personal details to claim your prize now.

output.description: Lottery-style phishing email claiming a large prize from Yahoo, but from an unverified domain.
indicators: Unsolicited prize announcement
Sender domain not affiliated with Yahoo
Request for personal data
Likely 419 or sweepstakes scam variant

instruction: Classify this email about a 'new friend request' from a social network. Is it legitimate?

input.subject: New Friend Request Waiting
input.body: Someone sent you a friend request. Sign in now: hxxp://connect-request.net/account

output.description: Phishing email feigning a social network friend request, redirecting to a credential-harvesting page.
indicators: Generic subject with no specific platform name
Link to an unknown domain (connect-request.net)
No mention of the friend’s name or profile
Immediate sign-in required

instruction: Examine this email about an auto-renewing antivirus subscription. Determine if it's phishing.

input.subject: Subscription Renewal Confirmation
input.body: Your antivirus will auto-renew for $299. Click here to cancel or manage your subscription: hxxp://nort0n-secure.com

output.description: Email uses a fake Norton billing scenario, urging recipients to click a fraudulent cancellation link.
indicators: Misspelled domain (nort0n-secure.com)
High renewal cost to incite panic
Link for cancellation that leads to phishing page
Likely scam to steal payment or personal info

instruction: Assess whether this email from 'Netflix' requesting account details is genuine or not.

input.subject: Problem with Your Last Payment
input.body: We couldn’t process your latest payment. Update your billing info to avoid service suspension: hxxp://netfl1x-update.com/verify

output.description: Phishing email impersonating Netflix, using a domain with a '1' in place of 'i' to trick recipients.
indicators: Domain spoofing (netfl1x-update.com)
Claim of payment failure with urgent fix
Link to a fake billing page
Likely card data theft attempt

instruction: Check this email claiming to be from 'HR Dept' about a bonus payout. Malicious or legitimate?

input.subject: Your Special Year-End Bonus
input.body: You qualify for an extra bonus. Please submit your employee ID and banking details here: hxxp://bonuses-corp.net/form

output.description: Phishing email targeting employees with fake bonus promises to collect sensitive info.
indicators: Domain not matching official company HR
Requesting banking details in a suspicious form
Generic approach instead of personalized HR message
Likely data harvesting attempt

instruction: Identify if this email about 'successful iTunes purchase' is a receipt or phishing attempt.

input.subject: Your iTunes Purchase Receipt
input.body: Thank you for your purchase of $49.99. If you did not authorize this, cancel here: hxxp://apple-billing.io/cancel

output.description: Email claims a purchase was made, tricking recipients into clicking a cancellation link to steal info.
indicators: Unrecognized domain (apple-billing.io)
Unexpected purchase alert causing alarm
Link to 'cancel' that leads to phishing site
Likely card or Apple ID credential theft

instruction: Determine if this inbound email from 'Microsoft' about OneDrive storage is authentic.

input.subject: OneDrive Storage Exceeded
input.body: Your OneDrive storage is over the limit. Resolve now to avoid data loss: hxxp://m1cro-soft-support.info/OneDrive

output.description: Phishing email impersonating Microsoft, using a domain with a letter replaced by a number.
indicators: Domain mismatch (m1cro-soft-support.info)
Immediate threat of data loss
URL not associated with official Microsoft domains
Generic 'update' or 'resolve now' link

instruction: Examine this email that includes an HTML attachment for 'payment details.' Is it safe?

output.description: Phishing attempt delivering an HTML file that opens a fake payment form in the browser.
indicators: Unsolicited payment confirmation request
HTML attachment (common phishing tactic)
Domain not related to official finance or billing channels
Likely form collecting sensitive data

instruction: Analyze this email claiming 'Facebook security check' is needed. Real or phishing?

input.subject: Security Check: Suspicious Login Attempt
input.body: We noticed a login from a new device. Verify your account now: hxxp://facebook-alerts.com/secure

output.description: Phishing email impersonating Facebook with a suspicious domain to collect credentials.
indicators: Domain not official (facebook-alerts.com instead of facebook.com)
Urgent login verification request
No mention of device details or location
Likely leads to credential-stealing page

instruction: Check if this email about unlocking a secret investment opportunity is phishing.

input.subject: Exclusive Shares for VIP Only
input.body: Buy shares now at a 90% discount! Enter your details: hxxp://privateshare-buyin.net/account

output.description: Phishing email promising exclusive investment, linking to a site that harvests financial data.
indicators: Unsolicited high-return investment opportunity
Unverified domain with no official financial registration
Asks for personal or banking info to 'buy shares'
Too-good-to-be-true discount

instruction: Decide if this inbound email threatening account closure for software licensing is legitimate.

input.subject: Software License Expiration Warning
input.body: Your software license will be revoked in 24 hours. Click here to renew and avoid termination.

output.description: Phishing email claims software license expiration, pressuring the user to click a renewal link.
indicators: Unknown domain for software licensing (license-expired-check.com)
Threat of immediate license termination
No mention of specific software or key details
Likely directs to payment or credential form

instruction: Evaluate if this email about 'Amazon suspicious order' is real or phishing. Provide red flags.

input.subject: Suspicious Order #AMZ-534213
input.body: We detected unauthorized activity on your account. Cancel the order here: hxxp://amzn-check-orders.net/cancel

output.description: Phishing email impersonating Amazon, forcing the recipient to 'cancel' a fake suspicious order.
indicators: Domain mismatch (amzn-check-orders.net)
Fake order number with no order details
Link to cancel leading to a phishing page
Urgency about unauthorized charge

instruction: Classify this inbound email posing as a 'feedback request' with a suspicious link.

input.subject: Urgent Survey: Win a Free Gift Card
input.body: Help us improve our services. Complete this short survey for a chance to win a $500 gift card: hxxp://customerreview-center.info/survey

output.description: Email falsely offering gift card for survey participation, likely collecting personal info or injecting malware.
indicators: Generic 'urgent survey' with high-value gift card reward
Unknown domain not linked to a known brand
Immediate request to click a link with personal questions
Likely phishing or data-harvesting tactic

instruction: Identify the legitimacy of this email about a 'Bitcoin reward' for loyal customers.

input.subject: You’ve Earned 0.5 BTC!
input.body: Congratulations on your loyalty! Claim your Bitcoin reward instantly: hxxp://cryptopromo.biz/claim

output.description: Phishing email pretending to reward the recipient with cryptocurrency for unknown 'loyalty.'
indicators: Unsolicited crypto reward offer
Suspicious domain (cryptopromo.biz)
Immediate claim link with no context
Likely attempt to collect wallet credentials

instruction: Analyze this email from 'DocuSign' requiring immediate signature. Could it be phishing?

input.subject: Document Awaiting Your Signature
input.body: An important document is ready for your signature. Please review: hxxp://docs-sign-urgent.com/view

output.description: Email masquerades as DocuSign, directing to a fake page for capturing login or personal details.
indicators: Domain not affiliated with official DocuSign
Urgent language requiring immediate signature
No reference to what the document is about
Likely credential-stealing or malware-laden link

instruction: Check if this email about an SSL certificate expiry is legitimate or a phishing attempt.

input.subject: SSL Certificate Expiring Soon
input.body: Please renew your certificate to avoid site downtime. Complete payment at hxxp://certificate-renew.info/pay

output.description: Phishing email claiming an SSL certificate expiry, instructing payment via a suspicious link.
indicators: Unknown domain not tied to a known certificate authority
Immediate payment request
Vague reference to 'your site' with no details
Likely to steal payment info

instruction: Determine if this inbound email about a 'membership auto-renewal' is genuine or phishing.

input.subject: Auto-Renewal Notice - $199 Charge
input.body: Your membership is set to renew. If you did not authorize this, click here to cancel: hxxp://unknown-member-service.org/cancel

output.description: Phishing email impersonating a membership service, pushing recipients to a cancel link for data theft.
indicators: No mention of membership details or service name
Urgent cancellation link to an unknown domain
High renewal fee to alarm user
Likely phishing for financial info

instruction: Identify red flags in this unsolicited email claiming a credit card promotion.

input.subject: Your Pre-Approved Platinum Card
input.body: Enjoy a $10,000 limit instantly. Just fill out our secure form: hxxp://exclusive-creditcard-apply.net/form

output.description: Phishing email offering high-limit credit card pre-approval through an unverified link.
indicators: Unsolicited credit offer with unrealistic terms
Suspicious domain with no official bank reference
Asks for personal or financial details upfront
Likely identity theft scam

instruction: Review this inbound email about 'account inactivity' for a streaming service. Phishing or real?

input.subject: Account Inactive - Immediate Action Needed
input.body: We noticed no recent activity. Reactivate now or lose your saved shows: hxxp://hulu-update.info/reactivate

output.description: Phishing email impersonating Hulu, using an unofficial domain to harvest user login credentials.
indicators: Sender domain not affiliated with Hulu
Threat of losing saved shows to spur quick action
Generic wording, no personal user details
Link likely leads to false login page

instruction: Classify this email urging to 'update security questions' at a suspicious link.

input.subject: Security Questions Update Required
input.body: To enhance your account security, please update your secret questions here: hxxp://account-recovery-center.com/secure

output.description: Phishing email requesting secret question updates, possibly for password reset exploitation.
indicators: Generic domain unrelated to actual provider
No brand context for which account is being secured
Direct link to 'update' security info
Likely tactic to gather info for account takeover

instruction: Analyze this email about an 'overcharged invoice' and identify phishing signals.

input.subject: Overcharged Invoice Refund
input.body: We have identified an overcharge on your last invoice. Click here to apply for a refund.

output.description: Phishing email using a refund claim to entice users to click a suspicious link.
indicators: No specific invoice number or details
Domain not matching known billing entities
Immediate refund promise with no verification
Likely request for personal or financial info

instruction: Decide if this email from an unknown shipping company about a 'lost package' is phishing.

input.subject: Urgent: Lost Package Notification
input.body: Our records show we lost your package. Confirm your delivery address: hxxp://parcel-finder.xyz/confirm

output.description: Phishing email claiming a lost package from an unknown shipping firm, seeking address or personal data.
indicators: Unrecognized shipping brand (parcel-finder.xyz)
Alarmist approach to confirm address
Likely data-harvesting link
No official tracking ID or prior communication

instruction: Evaluate if this email about 'LinkedIn password reset' is authentic or a phishing trap.

input.subject: LinkedIn Password Reset
input.body: Someone requested a password change. If this wasn’t you, please verify now: hxxp://l1nked-in-reset.com/verify

output.description: Phishing email impersonating LinkedIn, using a lookalike domain to capture login credentials.
indicators: Domain variation (l1nked-in-reset.com) with a digit replacing 'i'
Immediate call to verify or reset password
Generic 'someone requested' claim
Likely credential-harvesting page

instruction: Classify this email from a 'gaming platform' about a reward code. Is it phishing?

input.subject: You’ve Earned a Special Gaming Reward!
input.body: Redeem your code now to unlock exclusive in-game items: hxxp://game-bonus-portal.info/redeem

output.description: Phishing message feigning a gaming reward, redirecting to a fraudulent redemption page.
indicators: Sender domain not matching an official gaming platform
Generic language about 'special reward'
Urgent redemption link with no details
Likely attempts to steal account credentials

instruction: Determine if this inbound email about a job interview scheduling link is phishing.

input.subject: Interview Schedule Confirmation
input.body: Please confirm your availability and fill out this form with personal details: hxxp://jobs-opportunity-pro.com/apply

output.description: Phishing email disguised as HR scheduling an interview, requesting personal data via a dubious link.
indicators: Sender domain not matching any known company
Vague job description or position name
Form asks for sensitive personal details
Likely a data collection scam

instruction: Inspect this email about 'student loan consolidation' for phishing signs.

input.subject: Act Now: Lower Your Student Loan Payments
input.body: Qualify for a special interest rate. Provide your SSN and loan details at hxxp://loanconsolidate-express.org/app

output.description: Email claims special loan rates, demanding SSN and other sensitive data on a suspicious site.
indicators: Generic domain not linked to real loan servicers
Request for SSN in an unsecured manner
No official disclaimers or references
Likely identity theft or data-scraping attempt

instruction: Analyze this email about an 'urgent domain transfer request.' Is it phishing?

input.subject: Alert: Domain Transfer Initiated
input.body: A request to transfer your domain has been submitted. Cancel if unauthorized: hxxp://domain-transfer-service.co/cancel

output.description: Phishing email pretending a domain transfer was requested, prompting the user to click a cancel link.

Immediate fear tactic about losing domain
Suspicious cancel link with no official domain registry references
Likely a scam to harvest login or payment info

instruction: Check if this inbound email claiming an 'eFax document' is safe.

input.subject: New eFax Received
input.body: You have 1 new eFax. View the document at hxxp://efax-scan-report.me/download

output.description: Email claiming a new eFax with a link to download a file from a suspicious domain.
indicators: Domain not linked to official eFax service
No direct fax details (sender, time, pages)
Likely attempts to distribute malware or phishing page
Urgent tone to view document

instruction: Identify phishing cues in this email about a 'Google account violation.'

input.subject: Violation Detected in Your Google Account
input.body: We found a policy breach. Verify now or your account may be suspended: hxxp://google-violation-check.com/verify

output.description: Phishing email pretending to be from Google, referencing a policy breach that requires immediate verification.
indicators: Domain mismatch (google-violation-check.com)
Threat of suspension if not verified
Generic policy breach claim with no specifics
Likely credential-stealing link

instruction: Assess whether this email offering a 'work-from-home kit' is phishing or genuine.

input.subject: Earn $5,000 Weekly from Home!
input.body: Get your starter kit now. Submit your personal info: hxxp://home-jobs-official.net/apply

output.description: Phishing email with unrealistic earnings, requesting personal data to 'apply' for a home job kit.
indicators: Unrealistic income claims
Suspicious domain, not a known job platform
No specifics on the job role or company
Likely harvests personal/financial details

instruction: Analyze this inbound email claiming a 'Dropbox file share.' Real or phishing?

input.subject: New File Shared with You
input.body: A colleague has shared an important document. Access it now: hxxp://dropbx-portal.com/view

output.description: Email impersonating Dropbox with a domain that includes a misspelling ('dropbx'), leading to a phishing page.
indicators: Misspelled brand name in URL or sender
No mention of the colleague’s name or context
Calls for immediate action to view a doc
Likely credential-stealing link

instruction: Determine if this email about a suspicious login attempt is genuine or phishing.

input.subject: Suspicious Login Attempt on Your Account
input.body: We detected a login from Russia. If this wasn’t you, secure your account now: hxxp://accountlogin-security.info/check

output.description: Phishing email claiming a foreign login attempt, directing the recipient to a fake security link.
indicators: Domain not affiliated with an official provider
Threat of unauthorized foreign login
Immediate request to 'secure your account'
Potentially harvests credentials or personal info

instruction: Inspect this email about a mobile bill error. Decide if it's phishing.

input.subject: Billing Error Detected
input.body: We have overcharged your mobile bill by $45. Click to initiate refund: hxxp://mobile-net-verify.org/refund

Suspicious domain not tied to an actual carrier
No account number or verification method
Likely a malicious or phishing link

instruction: Assess if this email from 'Apple Support' about an iCloud storage problem is phishing.

input.subject: iCloud Storage Issue Detected
input.body: We noticed an error syncing your data. Verify your account details now to restore full functionality.

Immediate verification request for account details

instruction: Identify potential phishing traits in this email about a 'Discord Nitro subscription.'

input.subject: Your Discord Nitro Gift Subscription

Likely attempts to steal Discord credentials

instruction: Decide if this inbound email about an Adobe Creative Cloud 'upgrade needed' is phishing.

input.subject: Upgrade Required: Adobe Creative Cloud
input.body: Your Creative Cloud version is outdated. Upgrade now to continue using premium features: hxxp://creativecloud-srv.com/upgrade

Likely leads to credential or payment theft

instruction: Classify this email about a 'claimable airline voucher' for a canceled flight. Is it phishing?

instruction: Evaluate this email from an unknown domain about a 'Payoneer payment freeze.' Phishing or real?

instruction: Check if this 'Zelle payment request' email is legitimate or a phishing attempt.

instruction: Identify if this email about a 'Pinterest policy violation' is phishing. List red flags.

output.description: Phishing email claiming Pinterest guideline violation, directing user to a fake login page.

instruction: Examine this inbound email about a security alert from 'Your Cloud Backup.' Phishing or real?
